title: Domain 2.3: Explain various types of vulnerabilities.
content:
🧠 Application Vulnerabilities

  • 💉 Memory injection: Malicious code inserted into memory to alter behavior or gain access.
  • 📈 Buffer overflow: Overflowing a memory buffer to overwrite adjacent memory, leading to crashes or arbitrary code execution.
  • 🏁 Race conditions:
    • Time-of-check (TOC): Condition is checked.
    • Time-of-use (TOU): Condition is acted upon—exploitable delay.
  • 🔄 Malicious update: Software update is hijacked or replaced with malicious code.

💽 OS-based Vulnerabilities

Flaws in the operating system like unpatched kernels, insecure services, or privilege escalation bugs.

🌐 Web-based Vulnerabilities

  • 🛠️ SQL injection (SQLi): Malicious SQL inserted into input fields to manipulate databases.
  • 🖱️ Cross-site scripting (XSS): Injecting scripts into webpages to affect other users.

🧱 Hardware Vulnerabilities

  • 🧬 Firmware: Compromised firmware can persist through OS reinstalls.
  • 🛑 End-of-life: No support or security patches from the vendor.
  • 🕰️ Legacy: Outdated hardware lacking modern protections.

🧮 Virtualization Vulnerabilities

  • 🚪 VM Escape: Attacker escapes from a virtual machine to access the host.
  • ♻️ Resource Reuse: Data leakage between VMs due to poor isolation.

☁️ Cloud-Specific Vulnerabilities

Includes misconfigured storage, insecure APIs, and tenant isolation flaws.

🔗 Supply Chain Vulnerabilities

  • 🧰 Service Provider: Compromised third-party services (e.g., SolarWinds).
  • 🖥️ Hardware Provider: Malicious implants or flawed manufacturing designs.
  • 💽 Software Provider: Infected packages or compromised update pipelines.

🔐 Cryptographic Vulnerabilities

Weak algorithms, flawed key management, or outdated encryption exposing sensitive data.

⚙️ Misconfiguration

Weak settings like open databases, default passwords, or excessive permissions.

📱 Mobile Device Vulnerabilities

  • 📥 Sideloading: Installing apps from unofficial sources—risk of malware.
  • 🔓 Jailbreaking: Removing manufacturer protections—enables untrusted access.

🕳️ Zero-day

Unpatched vulnerabilities discovered and exploited before a fix is available.
